intro: Scleranthus peruvianus, commonly known as the Peruvian sandwort, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Peru. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, herbaceous structure. The plant typically has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tiny, pink or white flowers. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Scleranthus peruvianus is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
